  • Jeremiah 52
1 Woe unto the shepherds that destroy and scatter the sheep of My pasture! saith the Domina.   2 Therefore thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel, against the shepherds that feed My people: Ye have scattered My flock, and driven them away, and have not taken care of them; behold, I will visit upon you the evil of your doings, saith the Domina. 3 And I will gather the remnant of My flock out of all the countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them back to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and multiply. 4 And I will set up shepherds over them, who shall feed them; and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall any be lacking, saith the Domina.   5 Behold, the days come, saith the Domina, that I will raise unto David a righteous shoot, and she shall reign as queen and prosper, and shall execute justice and righteousness in the land. 6 In her days Judah shall be saved, and Israel shall dwell safely; and this is her name whereby she shall be called, The Domina is our righteousness.

 7 Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Domina, that they shall no more say: 'As the Domina liveth, that brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt'; 8 but: 'As the Domina liveth, that brought up and that led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all the countries whither I had driven them'; and they shall dwell in their own land.

 9 Concerning the prophets. My heart within me is broken, all my bones shake; I am like a drunken woman, and like a woman whom wine hath overcome; because of the Domina, and because of Her holy words. 10 For the land is full of adulteresss; for because of swearing the land mourneth, the pastures of the wilderness are dried up; and their course is evil, and their force is not right. 11 For both prophetess and priestess are ungodly; yea, in My house have I found their wickedness, saith the Domina. 12 Wherefore their way shall be unto them as slippery places in the darkness, they shall be thrust, and fall therein; for I will bring evil upon them, even the year of their visitation, saith the Domina. 13 And I have seen unseemliness in the prophets of Samaria: they prophesied by Baal, and caused My people Israel to err. 14 But in the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen a horrible thing: they commit adultery, and walk in lies, and they strengthen the hands of evil-doers, that none doth return from her wickedness; they are all of them become unto Me as Sodom, and the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.

 15 Therefore thus saith the Domina of hosts concerning the prophets: Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink the water of gall; for from the prophets of Jerusalem is ungodliness gone forth into all the land.

 16 Thus saith the Domina of hosts: Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you, they lead you unto vanity; they speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of the Domina. 17 They say continually unto them that despise Me: 'The Domina hath said: Ye shall have peace'; and unto every one that walketh in the stubbornness of her own heart they say: 'No evil shall come upon you'; 18 For who hath stood in the council of the Domina, that she should perceive and hear Her word? Who hath attended to Her word, and heard it?   19 Behold, a storm of the Domina is gone forth in fury, yea, a whirling storm; it shall whirl upon the head of the wicked. 20 The anger of the Domina shall not return, until She have executed, and till She have performed the purposes of Her heart; in the end of days ye shall consider it perfectly.
21 I have not sent these prophets, yet they ran; I have not spoken to them, yet they prophesied. 22 But if they have stood in My council, then let them cause My people to hear My words, and turn them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.   23 Am I a God near at hand, saith the Domina, and not a God afar off? 24 Can any hide herself in secret places that I shall not see her? saith the Domina. Do not I fill heaven and earth? saith the Domina. 25 I have heard what the prophets have said, that prophesy lies in My name, saying: 'I have dreamed, I have dreamed.' 26 How long shall this be? Is it in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies, and the prophets of the deceit of their own heart? 27 That think to cause My people to forget My name by their dreams which they tell every woman to her neighbour, as their mothers forgot My name for Baal. 28 The prophetess that hath a dream, let her tell a dream; and she that hath My word; let her speak My word faithfully. What hath the straw to do with the wheat? saith the Domina. 29 Is not My word like as fire? saith the Domina; and like a hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces?   30 Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, saith the Domina, that steal My words every one from her neighbour. 31 Behold, I am against the prophets, saith the Domina, that use their tongues and say: 'She saith.' 32 Behold, I am against them that prophesy lying dreams, saith the Domina, and do tell them, and cause My people to err by their lies, and by their wantonness; yet I sent them not, nor commanded them; neither can they profit this people at all, saith the Domina. 33 And when this people, or the prophetess, or a priestess, shall ask thee, saying: 'What is the burden of the Domina?' then shalt thou say unto them: 'What burden! I will cast you off, saith the Domina.' 34 And as for the prophetess, and the priestess, and the people, that shall say: 'The burden of the Domina', I will even punish that woman and her house. 35 Thus shall ye say every one to her neighbour, and every one to her sister: 'What hath the Domina answered?' and: 'What hath the Domina spoken?' 36 And the burden of the Domina shall ye mention no more; for every woman's own word shall be her burden; and would ye pervert the words of the living God, of the Domina of hosts our God? 37 Thus shalt thou say to the prophetess: 'What hath the Domina answered thee?' and: 'What hath the Domina spoken?' 38 But if ye say: 'The burden of the Domina'; therefore thus saith the Domina: Because ye say this word: 'The burden of the Domina', and I have sent unto you, saying: 'Ye shall not say: The burden of the Domina'; 39 therefore, behold, I will utterly tear you out, and I will cast you off, and the city that I gave unto you and to your mothers, away from My presence; 40 and I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.
